title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalist for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Garrett Crochet is a finalist for the AL Cy Young Award after leading the league in innings pitched (205.1) and strikeouts (255).
Red Sox rookie Roman Anthony is a finalist for the AL Rookie of the Year Award after playing 71 games with a .292 batting average.
The winners of the AL Cy Young and Rookie of the Year Awards will be announced next Wednesday on MLB Network.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots are eyeing upgrades at running back, edge rusher, linebacker, and secondary before the NFL trade deadline.
Arden Key and Jerome Ford are potential targets to enhance New England's depth and performance.
Bill Bridgewater's passing performance against the Falcons highlights the need for better pass-rushing capabilities.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots' offensive line has allowed 34 sacks this season, the second-most in the NFL.
Drake Maye has tied last season's sack total in fewer games, facing 12 sacks in the last two matches.
Center Garrett Bradbury acknowledges protection issues, while Maye admits some responsibility in holding the ball too long.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Liberty Hotel in Boston settled a discrimination complaint after a woman was wrongly accused of being a man by a security guard.
The hotel agreed to update non-discrimination policies, provide staff training, and donate $10,000 to an LGBTQIA2S+ nonprofit.
Ansley Baker, the woman involved, plans to file a civil lawsuit seeking punitive damages against the Liberty Hotel.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons coach Raheem Morris accused the Patriots of simulating Atlanta's snap count in their 24-23 loss.
Morris walked back his accusations, acknowledging frustration after the game influenced his comments.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel denied the accusations, attributing potential noise to enthusiastic fans.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opts out of his Red Sox contract, enters free agency with two years remaining.
Bregman hit .273/.360/.462 with 18 home runs and 62 RBIs for the Red Sox in 2025.
Red Sox, Tigers, and Mariners among teams interested in Bregman, a veteran leader and two-time World Series champion.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' front office, led by Eliot Wolf, is considering upgrades as the NFL trade deadline approaches.
Possible Patriots' trade targets include Miami's Jaylen Waddle and Saints' Alvin Kamara, requiring significant trade assets.
Patriots are considering player movements, including shopping OLB Anfernee Jennings despite being in buying mode.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm and fiancée Amanda welcomed their first child, Magnolia, last week, celebrating a personal milestone.
Lindholm returned to the Bruins' lineup after recovering from a lower-body injury, contributing to their 5-1-0 record with him.
The Bruins have improved defensively with Lindholm, reducing goals allowed from 4.25 to 2.3 per game when he's active.

title: Stefon Diggs playfully roasts Cardi B’s dance moves during Gillette Stadium appearance
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Cardi B supported boyfriend Stefon Diggs at Gillette Stadium, watching from the owner's suite during a close Patriots win.
Diggs humorously critiqued Cardi B's attempt to mimic his dance moves after scoring a touchdown in the second quarter.
The Patriots won 22-21 against the Falcons, extending their win streak to six games, despite a missed Atlanta extra point.

title: A bipartisan group of Mass. lawmakers called on Markey and Warren to help end the shutdown
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts lawmakers urge Senators Ed Markey and Elizabeth Warren to help end the ongoing government shutdown.
32 Massachusetts legislators express concern about federal shutdown's impact, affecting SNAP benefits, businesses, and low-income families.
Lawmakers call for a 'clean' short-term spending bill to resolve the stalemate; Markey and Warren previously voted against a House measure.
